snippet: Students from a school in Queens that was severely damaged by Hurricane Sandy have a long commute to a temporary campus where some classes are cramped.
abstract: Students from hurricane-ravaged Rockaway Park High School in Queens have had their lives upended, many of them displaced and scattered across New York City with long commutes to a temporary campus for classes; city's Education Department has reassigned 15,000 displaced students to other schools, adding confusion and hardship to an already difficult situation.
lead_paragraph: Students from a school in Queens that was severely damaged by Hurricane Sandy have a long commute to a temporary campus where some classes are cramped.

headline.seo: Displaced by Storm, Students Face Long Trek to Temporary School in Queens
headline.main: Uprooted in Storm, Students Endure Trek to Class
headline.print_headline: Uprooted in Storm, Students Endure Trek to Class

keywords.value: Rockaway Park High School for Environmental Sustainability
keywords.name: organizations
